intro: Manettia ciliata, commonly known as the silky manettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and velvety, hairy leaves. It typically grows as an understory plant in humid, shaded environments. Manettia ciliata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
